title: Hollywood Costume: Deborah Nadoolman Landis interview
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Costume design - Motion pictures
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Costume design
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Costume designers
abstract: Interview with curator of the 'Hollywood Costume' exhibtion.
description: Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis, an Oscar nominated Hollywood costume designer ('Raiders of the Lost Ark', 'Blues Brothers', Michael Jackson's 'Thriller') is the author of 'Hollywood Costume' (2012), the prize-winning catalogue for the exhibition, and 'Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration' (2012) among many other volumes. Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television. In this interview she talks about the origins of the Hollywood Costume industry, working as a costume designer, what a costume designer does and the relationship between the director and the costume designer.
